content: From everything that I can find on the Air Force tattoo policy, it is up to the member's commanding officer as to whether or not the tattoo is acceptable. If your commander in 2005 said it was okay, then I would imagine all you would need is verification that your commander at the time deemed the tattoo appropriate and within policy. Unfortunately, the Air Force policy doesn't have anything in it about exceptions/grandfathering those with tattoos before the policy was implemented. I'd also try a different recruiter... some are more lax than others.
